newsitem.title: TURKEY: Iraq miffed by sweet-toothed Saddam ad in Turkey.
newsitem.headline: Iraq miffed by sweet-toothed Saddam ad in Turkey.

text.p: A Turkish television advert showing President Saddam Hussein being distracted from war plans by a sweet tooth has angered Iraq.
Baghdad has lodged an official protest about the advert for a Turkish chocolate bar, a foreign ministry official said on Tuesday.
"Iraq complained last week. I think they were a bit too sensitive," he said.
In the advert, a Saddam look-alike actor and actors posing as his generals position tanks and rockets on a model of the desert and discuss military tactics.
A young boy appears on the scene distributing bars of chocolate, to the delight of a smiling Saddam who leaves the war games and thanks the lad in Arabic.
The Turkish official said he did not understand why Iraq was upset. "It's a nice advert. I actually thought the Americans would complain for showing Saddam in a good light," he said.
NATO member Turkey was part of the U.S.-led coalition that defeated neighbour Iraq in the 1991 Gulf War over Kuwait.
